basis.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: the facts, ideas, or things from which something can be developed
basis.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: Their claim had no basis in fact  (=it was not true).
Bread forms the basis of their daily diet.
The video will provide a basis for class discussion.
basis.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: the way that something happens, or the way that something is organized or done
basis.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: I’m saving money on a regular basis.
Board meetings are held on a weekly basis.
Nurses are employed on a full-time basis.
basis.translation[0].note_box[0].section: This research will form the basis of a book.
The poem provided the basis for an interesting class discussion.
Some of these ideas became the basis for the Parents’ Educational Union.
serve as a basis for something
The document will serve as a basis for negotiations.
The agreement established a sound basis for international commerce.
Our constitution has a democratic basis.
Many of these rumours have no basis in fact.
Love and trust form a good basis for marriage.
Drama school may provide a sound basis for an acting career.
basis.translation[0].note_box[1].section: the facts, ideas, things etc from which something can be developed
His work will be used as a basis for future research.
the thing on which something is based, especially something important that continues for a long time
Their ideas were the foundation for the political system that exists in the UK today.
How can we provide a solid foundation for world peace?
the most important thing that something depends on in order to be successful
Honesty is the bedrock of any healthy relationship.
Labour’s traditional bedrock of support is among the working classes.
the most important thing that something depends on in order to be successful, especially in business and politics
Confidence is the cornerstone of our business.
NATO remains a cornerstone of defence policy for Europe.
basis.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: the facts or ideas from which something can be developed
basis.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: If talks restart, this package is likely to be a basis for negotiation.
basis.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: the original figures from which something can be calculated or valued
basis.translation[1].definitions[1].exam: These figures will be the basis for future price calculations.
